org.jooby.couchbase

Interface AsyncDatastore


  • public interface AsyncDatastore

    datastore

    Create, read, update and delete entities from an AsyncBucket. It is similar to AsyncRepository but less verbose or more ready to use, but also add support for ViewQuery and N1qlQuery.

    design/implementation choices

    In order to abstract developers from doing basic CRUD operations, the following design has been made:

    • IDs look like: classname::id.
    • ID is also stored within the document as an attribute
    • A class attribute is also stored within the document

    Here is an example of a document for a class: model.Beer: 

    
 {
   "model.Beer::678": {
     "name": "IPA",
     "id": 678,
     "class": "model.Beer"
   }
 }

    ID selection

    In order to mark a class field as document ID, you must:

    • Name the field: id, or
    • Annotated the field with Id

    Auto-increment ID are supported by annotating the field with GeneratedValue and declare the field as Long. Then whenever you make a call to insert(Object) or upsert(Object) a new ID will be generated if need it.

    Since:
    1.0.0.CR7
    Author:
    edgar

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <T> rx.Observable<T> get(Class<T> entityClass,
                         Object id)
        Get an entity/document by ID. The unique ID is constructed via N1Q.qualifyId(Class, Object).
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - Entity class.
        id - Entity id.
        Returns:
        An observable entity matching the id or an empty observable.

      • getFromReplica

      • getAndLock

        <T> rx.Observable<T> getAndLock(Class<T> entityClass,
                                Object id,
                                int lockTime)
        Retrieve and lock a entity by its unique ID. If the entity is found, a entity is returned. If the entity is not found, the Observable completes without an item emitted (empty). This method works similar to get(Class, Object), but in addition it (write) locks the entity for the given lock time interval. Note that this lock time is hard capped to 30 seconds, even if provided with a higher value and is not configurable. The entity will unlock afterwards automatically. Detecting an already locked entity is done by checking for TemporaryLockFailureException. Note that this exception can also be raised in other conditions, always when the error is transient and retrying may help.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - Entity class.
        id - id the unique ID of the entity.
        lockTime - the time to write lock the entity (max. 30 seconds).
        Returns:
        an Observable eventually containing the found JsonDocument.

      • getAndTouch

        <T> rx.Observable<T> getAndTouch(Class<T> entityClass,
                                 Object id,
                                 int expiry)
        Retrieve and touch an entity by its unique ID. If the entity is found, an entity is returned. If the entity is not found, the Observable completes without an item emitted (empty). This method works similar to get(Class, Object), but in addition it touches the entity, which will reset its configured expiration time to the value provided.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - Entity class.
        id - id the unique ID of the entity.
        expiry - the new expiration time for the entity (in seconds).
        Returns:
        an Observable eventually containing the found JsonDocument.

                              Object id)
        Check whether a entity with the given ID does exist in the bucket.
        Parameters:

        id - Entity id.
        Returns:
        True, if exists.

      • upsert

        AsyncDatastore.AsyncCommand upsert()
        Returns:
        A new upsert command.

      • upsert

        default <T> rx.Observable<T> upsert(T entity)
        Insert or overwrite an entity. If the entity already has an ID, then that ID is selected. If the entity doesn't have an ID and the field is annotated with GeneratedValue this method will generate a new ID and insert the entity.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to insert or overwrite.
        Returns:
        Updated entity.

      • insert

        AsyncDatastore.AsyncCommand insert()
        Returns:
        A new insert command.

      • insert

        default <T> rx.Observable<T> insert(T entity)
        Insert an entity. If the entity already has an ID, then that ID is selected. If the entity doesn't have an ID and the field is annotated with GeneratedValue this method will generate a new ID and insert the entity.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to insert.
        Returns:
        Updated entity.

      • replace

        AsyncDatastore.AsyncCommand replace()
        Replace an entity if it does exist and watch for durability constraints.
        Returns:
        A new replace command.

      • replace

        default <T> rx.Observable<T> replace(T entity)
        Replace an entity if it does exist and watch for durability constraints. This method works exactly like AsyncBucket.replace(Document), but afterwards watches the server states if the given durability constraints are met. If this is the case, a new document is returned which contains the original properties, but has the refreshed CAS value set.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type.
        Parameters:
        entity - An entity to replace.
        Returns:
        The replace entity.

      • remove

        AsyncDatastore.AsyncRemoveCommand remove()
        Removes an entity from the Server. The an entity returned just has the document ID and its CAS value set, since the value and all other associated properties have been removed from the server.
        Returns:
        A new remove command.

      • remove

        default rx.Observable<Long> remove(Object entity)
        Removes an entity from the Server. The an entity returned just has the document ID and its CAS value set, since the value and all other associated properties have been removed from the server.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to remove.
        Returns:
        The cas value.
